results.title: Influence of West African Ethnicity and Gender on Beta-Cell Function and Insulin Sensitivity in Essential Hypertensives Treated with Hydrochlorothiazide and Hydrochlorothiazide-lisinopril Combination
results.text_hl: A total of 80 newly diagnosed Nigerian @<m>DISEASE_Essential_Hypertension</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000075222 @@@essential hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were assigned to receive either @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCT@@@ 25 mg daily or both @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCT@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lis@@@; 25/10 mg daily) in an open-label study for 12 weeks.

citations.NLM: Olamoyegun M, Kolawole B, Ajayi AAL. Influence of West African Ethnicity and Gender on Beta-Cell Function and Insulin Sensitivity in Essential Hypertensives Treated with Hydrochlorothiazide and Hydrochlorothiazide-lisinopril Combination J Pharmacol Pharmacother. 2017 Apr-Jun;8(2):68-73. PMID: 28706401
